{"blocks":[{"key":"4rg6f","text":"Gibson Assembly technology uses homologous recombination to assemble adjacent DNA fragments that share end-terminal homology. The optimal length of the homologous fragment ends region depends on \nthe number and length of the fragments in the assembly reaction.
